snippet: A dispute between China and South Korea scuttled a deal that would have reduced global tariffs on $1 trillion in information technology goods.
abstract: Geneva talks between United States and China that would have reduced global tariffs on $1 trillion on high-technology products collapse; accord breaks down in middle of face-off between China and South Korea over liquid-crystal display television screens; China has rebuffed appeals from US and Korean negotiators, and even from head of World Trade Organization.

byline.original: By JONATHAN WEISMAN and PAUL MOZUR
byline.contributor: Jonathan Weisman reported from Washington and Paul Mozur from Hong Kong. Mark Scott contributed reporting from London.

lead_paragraph: A dispute between China and South Korea scuttled a deal that would have reduced global tariffs on $1 trillion in information technology goods.

headline.main: W.T.O. Fails on High-Tech Tariff Deal
headline.print_headline: W.T.O. Fails on High-Tech Tariff Deal
